summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions on Côte d'Ivoire, particularly 2226 (2015) and 2219 (2015), and statements on the situation,

Noting the Secretary-General's report of 8 December 2015 on the drawdown of UNOCI,

Welcoming the successful presidential election on 25 October 2015 as a critical milestone in consolidating peace and stability,

Commending the Government, Independent Electoral Commission, and Ivorian security forces for their roles in the election,

Welcoming progress made in Côte d'Ivoire on reconciliation, stability, security, justice, and economic recovery,

Determining the situation in Côte d'Ivoire continues to pose a threat to international peace and security,

Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,

1. Decides to decrease UNOCI's military component from 5,437 to 4,000 military personnel by 31 March 2016;

2. Recalls its request to the Secretary-General to provide a report by 31 March 2016 with recommendations on the situation;

3. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
